body:
Time option in filter box is OK itself.

My suggestion is to enhance "Range Filter" in "time series" view to act as time filter for other slices when used on dashboard

Ran into this problem myself... albeit a slightly different flavour and am running MariaDB. 

Not sure how easy it is to query/update SQLite3 but editing the tables manually may help: 

https://github.com/amancevice/caravel/issues/14
LGTM
A PR would be appreciated of course, regarding the place to add them i suppose just add them as npm dependencies like the others js libraries and require them where needed?
Closing as dup of #1302
I think polyfills have to be global but I'll give it a try.

Seems still not fixed

> 2016-10-10 09:28:06,498:ERROR:root:'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xe4 in position 1: ordinal not in range(128)
> Traceback (most recent call last):
>   File "/httx/run/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/caravel-0.11.0-py2.7.egg/caravel/views.py", line 1183, in explore
>     viz_obj.get_json(),
>   File "/httx/run/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/caravel-0.11.0-py2.7.egg/caravel/viz.py", line 318, in get_json
>     'data': self.get_data(),
>   File "/httx/run/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/caravel-0.11.0-py2.7.egg/caravel/viz.py", line 1127, in get_data
>     chart_data = self.to_series(df)
>   File "/httx/run/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/caravel-0.11.0-py2.7.egg/caravel/viz.py", line 1106, in to_series
>     name = [text_type(s) for s in name]
> UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xe4 in position 1: ordinal not in range(128)
Looks like a limitation with flask-application-builder (or the way we are using it). We need to pass explicitly the next url we want to be redirected after login
@auroralinan what does it happen if you comment the line  `name = [text_type(s) for s in name]` ?

@xrmx Same error at next if condition

```
if len(self.form_data.get('metrics')) > 1:
                    series_title = ", ".join(name)
                else:
                    series_title = ", ".join(name[1:])  #this line cause error
```

Now I can fix it by force set default encoding by 

```
import sys
reload(sys)
sys.setdefaultencoding('utf-8')
```

But I don't think it's a good solution.
Hope for your opinion.
Could you please add a debug print to see what stuff we have there? `print([type(n) for n in name])`

@rohancs, instructions for making your own build are available in the "Making your own build
" section of http://airbnb.io/caravel/installation.html:

> For more advanced users, you may want to build Caravel from sources. That would be the case if you fork the project to add features specific to your environment.:
> 
> ```
> # assuming $CARAVEL_HOME as the root of the repo
> cd $CARAVEL_HOME/caravel/assets
> npm install
> npm run prod
> cd $CARAVEL_HOME
> python setup.py install
> ```
https://github.com/airbnb/caravel/issues/1309

let's ship this as-is and resolve the issue with less variables in the future. thanks for adding an issue!

🚢
assigned this one to you vera, i think we could mark this as done since you've been rewriting the control elements to use react-select
Awesome!
@vera-liu - what do you think about specifying database name and no user id in the share link ?
Opened another issue for this : https://github.com/airbnb/caravel/issues/1310
Thanks for reviewing!! Addressed all comments in the new commit :) @ascott
i've noticed that too, fix here: https://github.com/airbnb/caravel/pull/1312
LGTM
Thanks for the fix!

I meant a bit different thing. For the external product to be able to open a query in SQL Lab it would be challenging to know the user_id and database_id:
- User ID is already known in state, that should not be parameter, and when different user open's the query up - it should be tied to his account.
- Database name  should be sufficient for us to look up the database id 
- Schema may be needed as user can create the query using database and schema.
I think this will be superseded by #753
@258871355 coud you please stop to do your experiment against us? thanks

Is there any news regarding these changes / pull request ?

The same issue applies on wsgi serving with Apache for example:
in apache config: 
          WSGIScriptAlias /**myapp** /var/www/dashboard/flaskacct.wsgi

but immediately I get a 404 with **http://myhost/caravel/welcome** without preserving the baseurl like 
http://myhost/myapp/caravel/welcome.

I haven't had time to work on this, I do know though that even if somehow you manage to preserve the baseurl and not being redirected, there are still many absolute links pointing to "/" instead of using "url_for"
Dup of #767?
Yep looks to be the same one (though I think that this one has better description as it already relates to existing time filter :) )

Care to cook a patch? Adding this at the top of the function should do it:

```
 if g.user.is_anonymous():
    return False
```
I'll try.
The change is breaking some tests. I wrote a test for the bug and it seems to work fine, but some other tests are failing now. Looking into it a bit later.
Thanks! LGTM, let's wait for the tests to finish though :)

@kingo55 Thank you for the pointer. I've tried that but am still having a similar issue. First for others, sqlite3 does not support alter removing columns, so I had to create a new table, copy the data over, remove the old table, then move the new table back by doing the following:

```
CREATE TABLE "table_columns_new" (
created_on DATETIME NOT NULL,
changed_on DATETIME NOT NULL,
id INTEGER NOT NULL,
table_id INTEGER,
column_name VARCHAR(255),
is_dttm BOOLEAN,
is_active BOOLEAN,
type VARCHAR(32),
groupby BOOLEAN,
count_distinct BOOLEAN,
sum BOOLEAN,
max BOOLEAN,
min BOOLEAN,
filterable BOOLEAN,
description TEXT,
created_by_fk INTEGER,
changed_by_fk INTEGER,
expression TEXT,
verbose_name VARCHAR(1024),
PRIMARY KEY (id),
CHECK (is_dttm IN (0, 1)),
CHECK (is_active IN (0, 1)),
CHECK (groupby IN (0, 1)),
CHECK (count_distinct IN (0, 1)),
CHECK (sum IN (0, 1)),
CHECK (max IN (0, 1)),
CHECK (min IN (0, 1)),
CHECK (filterable IN (0, 1)),
FOREIGN KEY(created_by_fk) REFERENCES ab_user (id),
FOREIGN KEY(changed_by_fk) REFERENCES ab_user (id),
FOREIGN KEY(table_id) REFERENCES tables (id)
);

insert into table_columns_new select created_on, changed_on, id, table_id, column_name, is_dttm, is_active, type, groupby, count_distinct, sum, max, min, filterable, description, created_by_fk, changed_by_fk, expression, verbose_name from table_columns;

drop table table_columns;

alter table table_columns_new rename to table_columns;
```

I then did a `caravel db upgrade` and a `caravel init`

The init gives me the following error: 

```
2016-10-11 14:57:05,082:INFO:root:Creating database reference
2016-10-11 14:57:05,087:INFO:root:sqlite:////home/caravel/db/caravel.db
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1139, in _execute_context
    context)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/default.py", line 450, in do_execute
    cursor.execute(statement, parameters)
sqlite3.OperationalError: no such column: sql_metrics.d3format

The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/caravel", line 155, in <module>
    manager.run()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flask_script/__init__.py", line 412, in run
    result = self.handle(sys.argv[0], sys.argv[1:])
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flask_script/__init__.py", line 383, in handle
    res = handle(*args, **config)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flask_script/commands.py", line 216, in __call__
    return self.run(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/bin/caravel", line 64, in init
    utils.init(caravel)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/caravel/utils.py", line 295, in init
    init_metrics_perm(caravel)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/caravel/utils.py", line 312, in init_metrics_perm
    metrics += list(db.session.query(model).all())
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sqlalchemy/orm/query.py", line 2613, in all
    return list(self)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sqlalchemy/orm/query.py", line 2761, in __iter__
    return self._execute_and_instances(context)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sqlalchemy/orm/query.py", line 2776, in _execute_and_instances
    result = conn.execute(querycontext.statement, self._params)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 914, in execute
    return meth(self, multiparams, params)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sqlalchemy/sql/elements.py", line 323, in _execute_on_connection
    return connection._execute_clauseelement(self, multiparams, params)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1010, in _execute_clauseelement
    compiled_sql, distilled_params
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1146, in _execute_context
    context)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1341, in _handle_dbapi_exception
    exc_info
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sqlalchemy/util/compat.py", line 202, in raise_from_cause
    reraise(type(exception), exception, tb=exc_tb, cause=cause)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sqlalchemy/util/compat.py", line 185, in reraise
    raise value.with_traceback(tb)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1139, in _execute_context
    context)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/default.py", line 450, in do_execute
    cursor.execute(statement, parameters)
sqlalchemy.exc.OperationalError: (sqlite3.OperationalError) no such column: sql_metrics.d3format [SQL: 'SELECT sql_metrics.created_on AS sql_metrics_created_on, sql_metrics.changed_on AS sql_metrics_changed_on, sql_metrics.id AS sql_metrics_id, sql_metrics.metric_name AS sql_metrics_metric_name, sql_metrics.verbose_name AS sql_metrics_verbose_name, sql_metrics.metric_type AS sql_metrics_metric_type, sql_metrics.table_id AS sql_metrics_table_id, sql_metrics.expression AS sql_metrics_expression, sql_metrics.description AS sql_metrics_description, sql_metrics.is_restricted AS sql_metrics_is_restricted, sql_metrics.d3format AS sql_metrics_d3format, sql_metrics.changed_by_fk AS sql_metrics_changed_by_fk, sql_metrics.created_by_fk AS sql_metrics_created_by_fk \nFROM sql_metrics']
```

In app if I try to look at a table I get the following error (as part of a stack trace):

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1139, in _execute_context
    context)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/default.py", line 450, in do_execute
    cursor.execute(statement, parameters)
sqlite3.OperationalError: no such column: table_columns.python_date_format

[Not included stack trace, available upon request]

sqlalchemy.exc.OperationalError: (sqlite3.OperationalError) no such column: 
table_columns.python_date_format [SQL: 'SELECT table_columns.created_on AS 
table_columns_created_on, table_columns.changed_on AS table_columns_changed_on, 
table_columns.id AS table_columns_id, table_columns.table_id AS table_columns_table_id, 
table_columns.column_name AS table_columns_column_name, table_columns.verbose_name AS 
table_columns_verbose_name, table_columns.is_dttm AS table_columns_is_dttm, 
table_columns.is_active AS table_columns_is_active, table_columns.type AS table_columns_type, 
table_columns.groupby AS table_columns_groupby, table_columns.count_distinct AS 
table_columns_count_distinct, table_columns.sum AS table_columns_sum, table_columns.max AS 
table_columns_max, table_columns.min AS table_columns_min, table_columns.filterable AS 
table_columns_filterable, table_columns.expression AS table_columns_expression, 
table_columns.description AS table_columns_description, table_columns.python_date_format AS 
table_columns_python_date_format, table_columns.database_expression AS 
table_columns_database_expression, table_columns.changed_by_fk AS 
table_columns_changed_by_fk, table_columns.created_by_fk AS table_columns_created_by_fk 
\nFROM table_columns']
```

If I look at any dashboard I see the following where any slice should be:

```
(sqlite3.OperationalError) no such column: sql_metrics.d3format [SQL: 'SELECT 
sql_metrics.created_on AS sql_metrics_created_on, sql_metrics.changed_on AS 
sql_metrics_changed_on, sql_metrics.id AS sql_metrics_id, sql_metrics.metric_name AS 
sql_metrics_metric_name, sql_metrics.verbose_name AS sql_metrics_verbose_name, 
sql_metrics.metric_type AS sql_metrics_metric_type, sql_metrics.table_id AS 
sql_metrics_table_id, sql_metrics.expression AS sql_metrics_expression, sql_metrics.description 
AS sql_metrics_description, sql_metrics.is_restricted AS sql_metrics_is_restricted, 
sql_metrics.d3format AS sql_metrics_d3format, sql_metrics.changed_by_fk AS 
sql_metrics_changed_by_fk, sql_metrics.created_by_fk AS sql_metrics_created_by_fk \nFROM 
sql_metrics \nWHERE ? = sql_metrics.table_id'] [parameters: (19,)]
```
Thanks for taking the time to share this fix!
Fixed in 1e6e144d24da38aef0d306889dc3b8f962ca4b32 . Thanks again!
build doesn't go through...
@andrewhn @SalehHindi Has anyone given this a go yet? We also think this would be a great feature, but would be keen to hear of any new approaches that did/didn't work.

update: By going through the above process, but omitting the `caravel db stamp f162a1dea4c4` I get much further. Everything seems ok, except that all of tables are saying that the tables don't exist in the database. Looking into that now.

It looks like the issue is that I have to set the Datetime Format on my temporal columns again as otherwise no records show up.

I'll mark this closed now.
@jwthomp what was the rational for stamping `f162a1dea4c4`? Looks like this resulted in skipping needed migrations.
btw I wouldn't worry about the warning, it's coming from a db migration script

@mistercrunch My recollection is that when I was first trying to fix this I was seeing the alter error in https://github.com/airbnb/caravel/issues/817 so I tried that fix.

I'm guessing I misread the error.
Thanks for reviewing! I moved shortUrl out of CopyToClipboard and the ajax call to common.js. @mistercrunch
LGTM!
Happy to help! :)
Nice thanks for the pro-active fix!
I'm not sure this is the best way to do this, it's a shame it has to be added to each entry point.
@gschrader what browser are you trying to support?
@ascott It's the javafx webview browser, which I believe is based on an old version of webkit.

@ascott I'll try to do it that way, I'm a webpack newbie so I wasn't sure how that lined up with this structure:

```
  entry: {
    'css-theme': APP_DIR + '/javascripts/css-theme.js',
    dashboard: APP_DIR + '/javascripts/dashboard/Dashboard.jsx',
    explore: APP_DIR + '/javascripts/explore/explore.jsx',
    explorev2: APP_DIR + '/javascripts/explorev2/index.jsx',
    welcome: APP_DIR + '/javascripts/welcome.js',
    standalone: APP_DIR + '/javascripts/standalone.js',
    common: APP_DIR + '/javascripts/common.js',
    sqllab: APP_DIR + '/javascripts/SqlLab/index.jsx',
  },
```

I assume I just add the entry and then I'd have to add the built asset to the html template?

It also would be great, if i could edit what i set.
e.g. if i set 2016-05-12 and I want to modify it to 2016-05-10 I have to write the whole new text again. 

thanks!

you would remove the `require('babel-polyfill');` line in the templates and add babel-polyfill to the entry arrays like this... 

```
entry: {
  'css-theme': ['babel-polyfill', APP_DIR + '/javascripts/css-theme.js'],
  ...
},
```

the entry object can take either strings to a single file or an array.

thanks for the pr!

According to codeclimate support team, there isn't a good way to get this spread operator through at this moment. They are still trying to figure out a way to install the `node_modules` that are specified in a project. 
Since it's reported as a syntax error, I don't think it's possible to disable the check. We also don't want to put reducer files into exclude_path. So we may want to avoid using object rest spreader for the sake of codeclimate check, or ignore the codeclimate error? Any suggestions? @bkyryliuk @ascott @mistercrunch

I just tested this on IE 11 and there still seems to be a problem:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/868298/19318076/6bd6980c-9064-11e6-8113-30aa7cfe80cc.png)

the wrong url seems to be generated to grab the json, [IE url](http://qhefriooer.localtunnel.me/caravel/explore_json/table/3/?viz_type=big_number_total&granularity_sqla=ds&time_grain_sqla=Time+Column&since=100+years+ago&until=now&metric=sum__num&subheader=total+female+participants&y_axis_format=.3s&where=&having=&flt_col_0=&flt_op_0=in&flt_eq_0=&flt_col_1=gender&flt_op_1=in&flt_eq_1=girl&slice_id=24&slice_name=Number+of+Girls&collapsed_fieldsets=&action=&userid=1&goto_dash=false&datasource_name=birth_names&datasource_id=3&datasource_type=table&previous_viz_type=big_number_total&rdo_save=overwrite&new_slice_name=&add_to_dash=false&save_to_dashboard_id=&new_dashboard_name=&json=true&force=false) vs [Chrome url](http://qhefriooer.localtunnel.me/caravel/explore/table/3/caravel/explore_json/table/3/?viz_type=big_number_total&granularity_sqla=ds&time_grain_sqla=Time+Column&since=100+years+ago&until=now&metric=sum__num&subheader=total+female+participants&y_axis_format=.3s&where=&having=&flt_col_0=&flt_op_0=in&flt_eq_0=&flt_col_1=gender&flt_op_1=in&flt_eq_1=girl&slice_id=24&slice_name=Number+of+Girls&collapsed_fieldsets=&action=&userid=1&goto_dash=false&datasource_name=birth_names&datasource_id=3&datasource_type=table&previous_viz_type=big_number_total&rdo_save=overwrite&new_slice_name=&add_to_dash=false&save_to_dashboard_id=&new_dashboard_name=&json=true&force=false) . Looks like it's missing `caravel/explore/table/3` as a prefix.

This is maybe what was being reported in #1201 and I'm not sure why works fine in `browserstack.com`.

Regardless this change works for my other browser and can still hopefully be merged. Thanks!

do you have a PR, or can you provide more information about how you implemented the pdf export?

we are thinking about using a headless browser to take screenshots of dashboards (so the result would be a .png) with a couple of size options. adding the ability to directly download a chart from the explore page would also be pretty cool and potentially useful.

@bkyryliuk Added

For those who continue to run into this exception (like me)
even after getting the fix from #823, you must chose at least
one value for **`Ordering`** under **`NOT GROUPED BY`**
when building the slice or you will run into same exception when
trying to use the slice in a dashboard.
https://github.com/airbnb/caravel/pull/1314
You could first try to update npm and node: "It works with node v6.6.0 and npm v3.10.8. You can install the node module n with npm. Then update node with n and npm with npm install npm@latest -g. "
